remarks: If a function is integrable, then the ` S.2 ` integrals of the function's decompositions all exist.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jul-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2014.)
statement:
iblitg.1 $e |- ( ph -> G = ( x e. RR |-> if ( ( x e. A /\ 0 <_ T ) , T , 0 ) ) ) $.
iblitg.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> T = ( Re ` ( B / ( _i ^ K ) ) ) ) $.
iblitg.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> B ) e. L^1 ) $.
iblitg.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. V ) $.
iblitg $p |- ( ( ph /\ K e. ZZ ) -> ( S.2 ` G ) e. RR ) $.
$d A x $.
$d K x $.
$d V x $.
$d ph x $.
